history.content:
I think 126 is your best bet for 189. Some topics that you cover in 126 are directly applicable in 189 (MLE/MAP, joint gaussians, and geometric approach to regression). In addition, the rigor of the class will prepare you for the mathematical maturity needed for 189. Source: am current 189 student and 126 TA.

==============================================

140 was designed to prep you for 189, and covers MLE/MAP, joint gaussians, and geometric approach to regression, and I took 140 before 189 and it turned out great! That being said I didn't have 70 before I took 140.

I think 126 is your best bet for 189. Some topics that you cover in 126 are directly applicable in 189 (MLE/MAP, joint gaussians, and geometric approach to regression). In addition, the rigor of the class will prepare you for the mathematical maturity needed for 189. Source: am current 189 student and 126 TA.

In addition, the rigor of the class will prepare you for the mathematical maturity needed for 189. Source: am current 189 student and 126 TA.

children.subject: (OP) Thanks for the response. Do you think I should phase 1 126 or 140?

Phase 1 for 140 for sure. It's a very popular class and it's always full.

A lot of ppl will drop 126 after several weeks.

I would highly recommend *against* 134, just because (from what I hear) 140 and 126 are such better classes. I took 134 with 70 on a whim and kinda regret it. My gripes against 134 were

1) I did not like the Pitman textbook, and Lucas's lectures weren't that great imo either. In the parts of 70 and 134 that overlapped, I actually thought the 70 notes did a better job of teaching the material. The general quality of learning materials was lower than what I've seen in eecs department classes. (Probably doesn't apply to 140 though.)

2) The class wasn't as challenging as I had hoped, material-wise. All the quizzes/exams were straightforward applications of the material. The only exception to this were some of the homework problems (which were all straight out of the textbook), but homework was graded on 75% completion, so you'd need a ton of internal motivation to challenge yourself with it. I wasn't super self-motivated that semester, and I fell into the pattern of just cramming the material the day before a quiz. It worked for me grade-wise, but wasn't optimal learning-wise.

3) If you've already taken 70 and understood the material pretty well, 134 will be redundant. 70 covers at least half of the material in 134; 134 just spends a lot more time on continuous probability and introduces some common distributions.

134 isn't a bad class by any means - it's just that 126 (and maybe 140, not too sure about it) is better. I still learned a lot about probability, but looking at 126 homeworks, you learn a whole bunch of tricks, twists, turns, and conceptual background that 134 never touched on. Even though 134/126 is redundant at parts, I'll probably still take 126 eventually. It goes a good bit further than 134 anyways.

history.content: Hello! I am a Data Science student who wants to take 189 (either next summer or fall 2020). I was wondering if I should take EECS 126, STAT 140 or STAT134 next semester. I get conflicting information about these classes, and wanted to clear it up for myself. I have taken cs70, and I do somewhat like probability even though I am not that great at it (at least the first time, in cs70), and have taken up to math 54. I know 126 is hard, and I plan on taking 170 and ee120 next semester, but if I am looking to take 189, which of those 3 classes probability courses should I take? I also would like to know if I should phase 1 any of these classes as well. Thanks.
history.subject: [Recommendation] EECS126 or STAT140/134
